title: Crazy Frog fans horrified as noughties icon is ‘presumed dead’
text:
Crazy Frog fans have been left heartbroken after discovering that the icon is officially ‘presumed dead’ after being inactive on social media for years.

Now this is one celeb death we didn’t see coming.

Fans on Twitter, who were presumably innocently reliving the star’s best hits, made the upsetting discovery on his Wikipedia page.

‘In 2009, it was reported on the Crazy Frog Twitter account that the character had supposedly contracted swine flu,’ it reads. ‘The next creditable tweet is the character stating “I WANT TO GO TO PARIS”.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘After his final tweet on 22nd June 2009, Crazy Frog has not been active, implying he died in Paris in the summer of 2009. No uploads have been featured on the official YouTube page since this date also.’

A moment of silence for our fallen comrade, please.

Fans of the late star have paying tribute on social media, with one writing: ‘WHAT THE F*** CRAZY FROG IS DEAD.’

YouTuber iNabber added: ‘Crazy Frog is dead. Can everyone please reply “Rest In Peace Crazy Frog”. Rest In Peace Crazy Frog.’

‘Okay, was anyone going to tell me that crazy frog died, or was I just supposed to read that in the crazy frog wiki page myself,’ one more heartbroken fan asked.

Horrified fans took to social media (Pictures: Twitter)

However, it could just be that the star is taking a break from social media as his YouTube channel still boasts regular uploads, the most recent being back in September.

In fact, the channel appears to be thriving 14 years on from Axel F, and 22 years on from Crazy Frog’s creation, with a following of 6.9 million.

The most recent video, titled ‘Pinocchio’, sees the star running through a house of horrors, before being shot out of a cannon in a 33-second whirlwind.

Meanwhile, in the comments, fans have been calling for him to make a full comeback.

You never know, guys.

description: Crazy Frog fans horrified as noughties icon and Axel F hitmaker is 'presumed dead', although YouTube channel is still active.
